intro: Tulipa hypanica, commonly known as the Persian tulip, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, strap-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. The bulbs of Tulipa hypanica are also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
